ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಮಾಡು lekkia māḍu to count; to reckon; ಲೆಕ್ಕಕ್ಕೆ ಮಾತ್ರ ಇರು lekkiakke mātra iru to be physically available without any importance or without being considered seriously for anything; ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಹಾಕು lekkia hāku = ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಮಾಡು; 2. to consider; to take into consideration; 3. to plan; to scheme; ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಬಿಡಿಸು lekkia biḍisu to solve a mathematical problem; 2. to solve a perplexing, difficult situation; ಲೆಕ್ಕದಾಳು lekkiadāḷu a person who is physically present, but useless; ಲೆಕ್ಕಕ್ಕೆ ಇಲ್ಲದಿರು lekkakke illadiru not to be considered, taken into consideration; to be ignored; ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಕೊಡು lekkia koḍu to give account of the money received, spent etc; 2. to be responsible for; ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಒಪ್ಪಿಸಲು ಹೋಗು lekkia oppisalu hōgu (col.) to die; ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಒಪ್ಪಿಸು lekkia oppisu = ಲೆಕ್ಕ ಕೊಡು; ಲೆಕ್ಕಕ್ಕೆ ಬರದಿರು lekkakke baradiru = ಲೆಕ್ಕಕ್ಕೆ ಇಲ್ಲದಿರು.

the totality of the earth, sky and heavenly bodies as can be comprehended; the world.
the earth.
common people.
all human beings; the human race; mankind.
the common behaviour, mode of general public.
the act of seeing; perception by the eyes; sight.
any of the fourteen mythological worlds (including the earth).
(math.) a symbol for the number three.
(math.) a symbol for the number seven.
(math.) a symbol for the number fourteen.
ಲೋಕ ಕಂಡವನು lōka kaṇḍavanu a man having rich practical experience; ಲೋಕರ್ lōkar common people.
a man characterised by devilish, inhuman, outrageously cruel characters.
the creator of the universe; the Supreme Being.
the welfare of all the people in the world.
